parts: Python code to read logs from a specific Google Cloud function
flattened: Python code to read logs from a specific Google Cloud function

parts:
To read logs from a specific Google Cloud Function using Python, you can utilize the Cloud Logging API and the `google-cloud-logging` library. Here's an example code snippet that demonstrates how to achieve this:

```python
from google.cloud import logging

def read_cloud_function_logs(project_id, function_name):
    # Initialize the Cloud Logging client
    client = logging.Client(project=project_id)

    # Construct the log name for the Cloud Function
    log_name = "projects/{}/logs/{}".format(project_id, function_name)

    # Query the logs for the Cloud Function
    logs = client.list_entries(filter_='logName="{}"'.format(log_name))

    # Print the log entries
    for log in logs:
        print(log.payload)

# Set your project ID and Cloud Function name
project_id = "your-project-id"
function_name = "your-cloud-function-name"

# Call the function to read logs
read_cloud_function_logs(project_id, function_name)
```

Make sure you have the `google-cloud-logging` library installed before running the code. You can install it using `pip`:

```
pip install google-cloud-logging
```

Remember to replace `"your-project-id"` with your actual project ID and `"your-cloud-function-name"` with the name of your specific Cloud Function.
